verses.verse: How doth the city<WH5892> sit<WH3427> solitary<WH910>, that was full<WH7227> of people<WH5971>! how is she become as a widow<WH490>! she that was great<WH7227> among the nations<WH1471>, and princess<WH8282> among the provinces<WH4082>, how is she become tributary<WH4522>!

She weepeth<WH1058> sore<WH1058> in the night<WH3915>, and her tears<WH1832> are on her cheeks<WH3895>: among all her lovers<WH157> she hath none to comfort<WH5162> her: all her friends<WH7453> have dealt treacherously<WH898> with her, they are become her enemies<WH341>.

Judah<WH3063> is gone into captivity<WH1540> because of affliction<WH6040>, and because of great<WH7230> servitude<WH5656>: she dwelleth<WH3427> among the heathen<WH1471>, she findeth<WH4672> no rest<WH4494>: all her persecutors<WH7291> overtook<WH5381> her between the straits<WH4712>.

The ways<WH1870> of Zion<WH6726> do mourn<WH57>, because none come<WH935> to the solemn feasts<WH4150>: all her gates<WH8179> are desolate<WH8074>: her priests<WH3548> sigh<WH584>, her virgins<WH1330> are afflicted<WH3013>, and she is in bitterness<WH4843>.

Her adversaries<WH6862> are the chief<WH7218>, her enemies<WH341> prosper<WH7951>; for the LORD<WH3068> hath afflicted<WH3013> her for the multitude<WH7230> of her transgressions<WH6588>: her children<WH5768> are gone<WH1980> into captivity<WH7628> before<WH6440> the enemy<WH6862>.

And from the daughter<WH1323> of Zion<WH6726> all her beauty<WH1926> is departed<WH3318>: her princes<WH8269> are become like harts<WH354> that find<WH4672> no pasture<WH4829>, and they are gone<WH3212> without strength<WH3581> before<WH6440> the pursuer<WH7291>.

Jerusalem<WH3389> remembered<WH2142> in the days<WH3117> of her affliction<WH6040> and of her miseries<WH4788> all her pleasant things<WH4262> that she had in the days<WH3117> of old<WH6924>, when her people<WH5971> fell<WH5307> into the hand<WH3027> of the enemy<WH6862>, and none did help<WH5826> her: the adversaries<WH6862> saw<WH7200> her, and did mock<WH7832> at her sabbaths<WH4868>.

Jerusalem<WH3389> hath grievously<WH2399> sinned<WH2398>; therefore she is removed<WH5206>: all that honoured<WH3513> her despise<WH2107> her, because they have seen<WH7200> her nakedness<WH6172>: yea, she sigheth<WH584>, and turneth<WH7725> backward<WH268>.

Her filthiness<WH2932> is in her skirts<WH7757>; she remembereth<WH2142> not her last end<WH319>; therefore she came down<WH3381> wonderfully<WH6382>: she had no comforter<WH5162>. O LORD<WH3068>, behold<WH7200> my affliction<WH6040>: for the enemy<WH341> hath magnified<WH1431> himself.

The adversary<WH6862> hath spread out<WH6566> his hand<WH3027> upon all her pleasant things<WH4261>: for she hath seen<WH7200> that the heathen<WH1471> entered<WH935> into her sanctuary<WH4720>, whom thou didst command<WH6680> that they should not enter<WH935> into thy congregation<WH6951>.

All her people<WH5971> sigh<WH584>, they seek<WH1245> bread<WH3899>; they have given<WH5414> their pleasant things<WH4261><WH4262> for meat<WH400> to relieve<WH7725> the soul<WH5315>: see<WH7200>, O LORD<WH3068>, and consider<WH5027>; for I am become vile<WH2151>.

¶ Is it nothing to you, all ye that pass<WH5674> by<WH1870>? behold<WH5027>, and see<WH7200> if there be<WH3426> any sorrow<WH4341> like unto my sorrow<WH4341>, which is done<WH5953> unto me, wherewith the LORD<WH3068> hath afflicted<WH3013> me in the day<WH3117> of his fierce<WH2740> anger<WH639>.

From above<WH4791> hath he sent<WH7971> fire<WH784> into my bones<WH6106>, and it prevaileth<WH7287> against them: he hath spread<WH6566> a net<WH7568> for my feet<WH7272>, he hath turned<WH7725> me back<WH268>: he hath made<WH5414> me desolate<WH8074> and faint<WH1739> all the day<WH3117>.

The yoke<WH5923> of my transgressions<WH6588> is bound<WH8244> by his hand<WH3027>: they are wreathed<WH8276>, and come up<WH5927> upon my neck<WH6677>: he hath made my strength<WH3581> to fall<WH3782>, the Lord<WH136> hath delivered<WH5414> me into their hands<WH3027>, from whom I am not able<WH3201> to rise up<WH6965>.

The Lord<WH136> hath trodden under foot<WH5541> all my mighty<WH47> men in the midst<WH7130> of me: he hath called<WH7121> an assembly<WH4150> against me to crush<WH7665> my young men<WH970>: the Lord<WH136> hath trodden<WH1869> the virgin<WH1330>, the daughter<WH1323> of Judah<WH3063>, as in a winepress<WH1660>.

For these things I weep<WH1058>; mine eye<WH5869>, mine eye<WH5869> runneth down<WH3381> with water<WH4325>, because the comforter<WH5162> that should relieve<WH7725> my soul<WH5315> is far<WH7368> from me: my children<WH1121> are desolate<WH8074>, because the enemy<WH341> prevailed<WH1396>.

Zion<WH6726> spreadeth forth<WH6566> her hands<WH3027>, and there is none to comfort<WH5162> her: the LORD<WH3068> hath commanded<WH6680> concerning Jacob<WH3290>, that his adversaries<WH6862> should be round about<WH5439> him: Jerusalem<WH3389> is as a menstruous woman<WH5079> among them.

¶ The LORD<WH3068> is righteous<WH6662>; for I have rebelled<WH4784> against his commandment<WH6310>: hear<WH8085>, I pray you, all people<WH5971>, and behold<WH7200> my sorrow<WH4341>: my virgins<WH1330> and my young men<WH970> are gone<WH1980> into captivity<WH7628>.

I called<WH7121> for my lovers<WH157>, but they deceived<WH7411> me: my priests<WH3548> and mine elders<WH2205> gave up the ghost<WH1478> in the city<WH5892>, while they sought<WH1245> their meat<WH400> to relieve<WH7725> their souls<WH5315>.

Behold<WH7200>, O LORD<WH3068>; for I am in distress<WH6887>: my bowels<WH4578> are troubled<WH2560>; mine heart<WH3820> is turned<WH2015> within<WH7130> me; for I have grievously<WH4784> rebelled<WH4784>: abroad<WH2351> the sword<WH2719> bereaveth<WH7921>, at home<WH1004> there is as death<WH4194>.

They have heard<WH8085> that I sigh<WH584>: there is none to comfort<WH5162> me: all mine enemies<WH341> have heard<WH8085> of my trouble<WH7451>; they are glad<WH7797> that thou hast done<WH6213> it: thou wilt bring<WH935> the day<WH3117> that thou hast called<WH7121>, and they shall be like<WH3644> unto me.

Let all their wickedness<WH7451> come<WH935> before<WH6440> thee; and do<WH5953> unto them, as thou hast done<WH5953> unto me for all my transgressions<WH6588>: for my sighs<WH585> are many<WH7227>, and my heart<WH3820> is faint<WH1742>.
